plentry.pd: ID of the sound isolation zone.
Spatial center point of the sound isolation zone. This parameter is an array of length 3, representing the coordinates in the forward, right, and up directions.
Unit vector in the forward direction from position. This parameter is an array of length 3 representing the coordinates in the forward, right, and up directions.
Unit vector in the right direction from position. This parameter is an array of length 3 representing the coordinates in the forward, right, and up directions.
Unit vector in the upward direction from position. This parameter is an array of length 3 representing the coordinates in the forward, right, and up directions.
Treating the sound isolation zone as a cube, this represents the length of the forward edge, in game engine units.
Treating the sound isolation zone as a cube, this represents the length of the right edge, in game engine units.
Treating the sound isolation zone as a cube, this represents the length of the upward edge, in game engine units.

Sound attenuation coefficient when users inside and outside the sound isolation zone communicate. Value range: [0,1]:
0: Broadcast mode. Volume and timbre do not attenuate with distance.
(0,0.5): Weak attenuation. Volume and timbre attenuate slightly, allowing sound to travel farther than in real environments.
0.5: Simulates real-world volume attenuation. Equivalent to not setting audioAttenuation.
(0.5,1]: Strong attenuation (default is 1). Volume and timbre attenuate rapidly.
ID of the sound isolation zone.
The spatial center point of the sound isolation zone. This parameter is an array of length 3, representing coordinates in the forward, right, and up directions respectively.
Unit vector pointing forward from position. This parameter is an array of length 3, representing coordinates in the forward, right, and up directions respectively.
Unit vector pointing right from position. This parameter is an array of length 3, representing coordinates in the forward, right, and up directions respectively.
Unit vector pointing upward from position. This parameter is an array of length 3, representing coordinates in the forward, right, and up directions respectively.
Treating the entire sound isolation zone as a cube, this represents the length of the forward edge, in game engine units.
Treating the entire sound isolation zone as a cube, this represents the length of the right edge, in game engine units.
Treating the entire sound isolation zone as a cube, this represents the length of the upward edge, in game engine units.

Sound attenuation coefficient when users inside and outside the sound isolation zone communicate. Value range: [0,1]. Where:
0: Broadcast mode, volume and timbre do not attenuate with distance; the local user hears no change regardless of distance.
(0,0.5): Weak attenuation mode; volume and timbre attenuate slightly, allowing sound to travel farther than in real environments.
0.5: Simulates real-world volume attenuation, equivalent to not setting audioAttenuation.
(0.5,1]: Strong attenuation mode (default is 1); volume and timbre attenuate rapidly.
ID of the sound insulation zone.
The spatial center point of the sound insulation zone. This parameter is an array of length 3, representing the coordinates in the forward, right, and up directions.
Unit vector in the forward direction starting from position. This parameter is an array of length 3, representing the coordinates in the forward, right, and up directions.
Unit vector in the right direction starting from position. This parameter is an array of length 3, representing the coordinates in the forward, right, and up directions.
Unit vector in the upward direction starting from position. This parameter is an array of length 3, representing the coordinates in the forward, right, and up directions.
Assuming the sound insulation zone is a cube, this represents the length in the forward direction, in game engine units.
Assuming the sound insulation zone is a cube, this represents the length in the right direction, in game engine units.
Assuming the sound insulation zone is a cube, this represents the length in the upward direction, in game engine units.

Sound attenuation coefficient when users inside and outside the sound insulation zone communicate. Value range: [0,1]:
0: Broadcast mode. Volume and timbre do not attenuate with distance.
(0,0.5): Weak attenuation. Slight attenuation of volume and timbre during transmission. Sound travels farther than in real environments.
0.5: Simulates real-world volume attenuation. Equivalent to not setting the audioAttenuation parameter.
(0.5,1]: Strong attenuation (default is 1). Rapid attenuation of volume and timbre during transmission.
The ID of the sound insulation zone.
The spatial center of the sound insulation zone. This parameter is an array of length 3, representing the coordinates in the forward, right, and up directions.
The unit vector in the forward direction from position. This parameter is an array of length 3, representing the coordinates in the forward, right, and up directions.
The unit vector in the right direction from position. This parameter is an array of length 3, representing the coordinates in the forward, right, and up directions.
The unit vector in the upward direction from position. This parameter is an array of length 3, representing the coordinates in the forward, right, and up directions.
Assuming the sound insulation zone is a cube, this represents the length in the forward direction, in game engine units.
Assuming the sound insulation zone is a cube, this represents the length in the right direction, in game engine units.
Assuming the sound insulation zone is a cube, this represents the length in the upward direction, in game engine units.

The sound attenuation coefficient when users inside and outside the sound insulation zone communicate. Range: [0,1]:
0: Broadcast mode, no volume or timbre attenuation with distance.
(0,0.5): Weak attenuation, slight volume and timbre attenuation, allowing sound to travel farther than in real environments.
0.5: Simulates real-world volume attenuation, same as not setting the audioAttenuation parameter.
(0.5,1]: Strong attenuation (default is 1), rapid volume and timbre attenuation during propagation.
